abstract_summ: In severe cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), viral pneumonia progresses to respiratory failure . Neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs) are webs of chromatin, microbicidal proteins, and oxidant enzymes that are released by neutrophils to contain infections . When not properly regulated, NETs have potential to propagate inflammation and microvascular thrombosis - including in the lungs of patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome .
